channel.title: CVE Feed for Apple -- iOS
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Apple -- iOS

item.title: CVE-2020-3828|2024-08-04T07:44:51.473Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: A lock screen issue allowed access to contacts on a locked device. This issue was addressed with improved state management. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.3.1 and iPadOS 13.3.1. A person with physical access to an iOS device may be able to access contacts from the lock screen.

item.title: CVE-2020-9850|2024-08-04T10:43:05.439Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: A logic issue was addressed with improved restrictions. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.5 and iPadOS 13.5, tvOS 13.4.5, watchOS 6.2.5, Safari 13.1.1, iTunes 12.10.7 for Windows, iCloud for Windows 11.2, iCloud for Windows 7.19. A remote attacker may be able to cause arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2020-3918|2024-08-04T07:52:20.579Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: An access issue was addressed with additional sandbox restrictions. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.4 and iPadOS 13.4, macOS Catalina 10.15.4, tvOS 13.4, watchOS 6.2. A local user may be able to view sensitive user information.

item.title: CVE-2020-9958|2024-08-04T10:50:57.832Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: An out-of-bounds write issue was addressed with improved bounds checking. This issue is fixed in iOS 14.0 and iPadOS 14.0. An application may be able to cause unexpected system termination or write kernel memory.

item.title: CVE-2020-9793|2024-08-04T10:43:04.587Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: A memory corruption issue was addressed with improved input validation. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.5 and iPadOS 13.5, macOS Catalina 10.15.5, tvOS 13.4.5, watchOS 6.2.5. A remote attacker may be able to cause arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2020-3883|2024-08-04T07:44:51.428Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: This issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.4 and iPadOS 13.4, macOS Catalina 10.15.4, tvOS 13.4, watchOS 6.2. An application may be able to use arbitrary entitlements.

item.title: CVE-2020-9878|2024-08-04T10:43:05.469Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: A buffer overflow issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.6 and iPadOS 13.6, macOS Catalina 10.15.6, tvOS 13.4.8, watchOS 6.2.8. Processing a maliciously crafted USD file may lead to unexpected application termination or arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2020-9802|2024-08-04T10:43:05.152Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: A logic issue was addressed with improved restrictions. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.5 and iPadOS 13.5, tvOS 13.4.5, watchOS 6.2.5, Safari 13.1.1, iTunes 12.10.7 for Windows, iCloud for Windows 11.2, iCloud for Windows 7.19. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2020-3859|2024-08-04T07:44:51.225Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: An inconsistent user interface issue was addressed with improved state management. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.3.1 and iPadOS 13.3.1. A person with physical access to an iOS device may be able to access contacts from the lock screen.

item.title: CVE-2020-3831|2024-08-04T07:44:51.060Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: A race condition was addressed with improved locking. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.3.1 and iPadOS 13.3.1. An application may be able to execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges.

item.title: CVE-2020-3897|2024-08-04T07:52:19.726Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: A type confusion issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.4 and iPadOS 13.4, tvOS 13.4, watchOS 6.2, Safari 13.1, iTunes for Windows 12.10.5, iCloud for Windows 10.9.3, iCloud for Windows 7.18. A remote attacker may be able to cause arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2020-9919|2024-08-04T10:43:05.419Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: A buffer overflow issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.6 and iPadOS 13.6, macOS Catalina 10.15.6, tvOS 13.4.8, watchOS 6.2.8, iTunes 12.10.8 for Windows, iCloud for Windows 11.3, iCloud for Windows 7.20. Processing a maliciously crafted image may lead to arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2020-3869|2024-08-04T07:44:51.305Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: An issue existed in the handling of the local user's self-view. The issue was corrected with improved logic. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.3.1 and iPadOS 13.3.1. A remote FaceTime user may be able to cause the local user's camera self-view to display the incorrect camera.

item.title: CVE-2020-9882|2024-08-04T10:43:05.469Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: A buffer overflow issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.6 and iPadOS 13.6, macOS Catalina 10.15.6, watchOS 6.2.8. Processing a maliciously crafted USD file may lead to unexpected application termination or arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2020-9819|2024-08-04T10:43:05.138Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: A memory consumption issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.5 and iPadOS 13.5, iOS 12.4.7, watchOS 6.2.5, watchOS 5.3.7. Processing a maliciously crafted mail message may lead to heap corruption.

item.title: CVE-2020-3836|2024-08-04T07:44:51.287Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: An access issue was addressed with improved memory management. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.3.1 and iPadOS 13.3.1, macOS Catalina 10.15.3, tvOS 13.3.1, watchOS 6.1.2. A malicious application may be able to determine kernel memory layout.

item.title: CVE-2020-9791|2024-08-04T10:43:04.628Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: An out-of-bounds read was addressed with improved input validation. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.5 and iPadOS 13.5, macOS Catalina 10.15.5, tvOS 13.4.5, watchOS 6.2.5. Processing a maliciously crafted audio file may lead to arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2020-9843|2024-08-04T10:43:05.397Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: An input validation issue was addressed with improved input validation. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.5 and iPadOS 13.5, tvOS 13.4.5, watchOS 6.2.5, Safari 13.1.1, iTunes 12.10.7 for Windows, iCloud for Windows 11.2, iCloud for Windows 7.19. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to a cross site scripting attack.

item.title: CVE-2020-9790|2024-08-04T10:43:04.803Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: An out-of-bounds write issue was addressed with improved bounds checking. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.5 and iPadOS 13.5, macOS Catalina 10.15.5, tvOS 13.4.5, watchOS 6.2.5, iTunes 12.10.7 for Windows, iCloud for Windows 11.2, iCloud for Windows 7.19. Processing a maliciously crafted image may lead to arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2020-9768|2024-08-04T10:43:05.148Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: A use after free issue was addressed with improved memory management. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.4 and iPadOS 13.4, tvOS 13.4, watchOS 6.2. An application may be able to execute arbitrary code with system privileges.

item.title: CVE-2020-9916|2024-08-04T10:43:05.505Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: A URL Unicode encoding issue was addressed with improved state management. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.6 and iPadOS 13.6, tvOS 13.4.8, watchOS 6.2.8, Safari 13.1.2, iTunes 12.10.8 for Windows, iCloud for Windows 11.3, iCloud for Windows 7.20. A malicious attacker may be able to conceal the destination of a URL.

item.title: CVE-2020-9813|2024-08-04T10:43:05.141Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: A logic issue existed resulting in memory corruption. This was addressed with improved state management. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.5 and iPadOS 13.5, macOS Catalina 10.15.5, tvOS 13.4.5, watchOS 6.2.5. A malicious application may be able to execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges.

item.title: CVE-2020-9795|2024-08-04T10:43:05.138Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: A use after free issue was addressed with improved memory management. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.5 and iPadOS 13.5, macOS Catalina 10.15.5, tvOS 13.4.5, watchOS 6.2.5. An application may be able to execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges.

item.title: CVE-2020-9976|2024-08-04T10:50:57.312Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: A logic issue was addressed with improved state management. This issue is fixed in iOS 14.0 and iPadOS 14.0, tvOS 14.0, watchOS 7.0. A malicious application may be able to leak sensitive user information.

item.title: CVE-2020-9816|2024-08-04T10:43:05.091Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: An out-of-bounds write issue was addressed with improved bounds checking. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.5 and iPadOS 13.5, macOS Catalina 10.15.5, tvOS 13.4.5, watchOS 6.2.5. Opening a maliciously crafted PDF file may lead to an unexpected application termination or arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2020-9844|2024-08-04T10:43:05.284Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: A double free issue was addressed with improved memory management. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.5 and iPadOS 13.5, macOS Catalina 10.15.5. A remote attacker may be able to cause unexpected system termination or corrupt kernel memory.

item.title: CVE-2020-9968|2024-08-04T10:50:57.394Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: A logic issue was addressed with improved restrictions. This issue is fixed in iOS 14.0 and iPadOS 14.0, macOS Catalina 10.15.7, tvOS 14.0, watchOS 7.0. A malicious application may be able to access restricted files.

item.description: An out-of-bounds read was addressed with improved input validation. Processing a maliciously crafted image may lead to arbitrary code execution.

item.description: A buffer overflow issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.6 and iPadOS 13.6, macOS Catalina 10.15.6, watchOS 6.2.8. Processing a maliciously crafted USD file may lead to unexpected application termination or arbitrary code execution.

item.description: A logic issue was addressed with improved validation. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.5 and iPadOS 13.5, macOS Catalina 10.15.5, tvOS 13.4.5. An application may be able to gain elevated privileges.

item.description: Multiple memory corruption issues were addressed with improved memory handling. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2020-3887|2024-08-04T07:52:19.930Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: A logic issue was addressed with improved restrictions. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.4 and iPadOS 13.4, tvOS 13.4, Safari 13.1, iTunes for Windows 12.10.5, iCloud for Windows 10.9.3, iCloud for Windows 7.18. A download's origin may be incorrectly associated.

item.title: CVE-2020-9808|2024-08-04T10:43:05.270Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: A memory corruption issue was addressed with improved state management. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.5 and iPadOS 13.5, macOS Catalina 10.15.5, tvOS 13.4.5, watchOS 6.2.5. An application may be able to cause unexpected system termination or write kernel memory.

item.title: CVE-2020-9820|2024-08-04T10:43:05.188Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: A logic issue was addressed with improved restrictions. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.5 and iPadOS 13.5. A remote attacker may be able to modify the file system.

item.title: CVE-2020-9931|2024-08-04T10:43:05.447Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: A denial of service issue was addressed with improved input validation. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.6 and iPadOS 13.6. A remote attacker may cause an unexpected application termination.

item.title: CVE-2020-3891|2024-08-04T07:52:19.520Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: A logic issue was addressed with improved state management. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.4 and iPadOS 13.4, watchOS 6.2. A person with physical access to a locked iOS device may be able to respond to messages even when replies are disabled.

item.title: CVE-2020-9829|2024-08-04T10:43:05.259Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: A validation issue was addressed with improved input sanitization. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.5 and iPadOS 13.5, tvOS 13.4.5, watchOS 6.2.5. Processing a maliciously crafted text message may lead to application denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2020-27929|2024-08-04T16:25:44.100Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: A logic issue existed in the handling of Group FaceTime calls. The issue was addressed with improved state management. This issue is fixed in iOS 12.4.9. A user may send video in Group FaceTime calls without knowing that they have done so.

item.title: CVE-2020-9911|2024-08-04T10:43:05.403Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: A logic issue was addressed with improved restrictions. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.6 and iPadOS 13.6, Safari 13.1.2. An issue in Safari Reader mode may allow a remote attacker to bypass the Same Origin Policy.

item.title: CVE-2020-9895|2024-08-04T10:43:05.474Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: A use after free issue was addressed with improved memory management. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.6 and iPadOS 13.6, tvOS 13.4.8, watchOS 6.2.8, Safari 13.1.2, iTunes 12.10.8 for Windows, iCloud for Windows 11.3, iCloud for Windows 7.20. A remote attacker may be able to cause unexpected application termination or arbitrary code execution.

item.description: A buffer overflow issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.6 and iPadOS 13.6, macOS Catalina 10.15.6, watchOS 6.2.8. Processing a maliciously crafted USD file may lead to unexpected application termination or arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2020-3919|2024-08-04T07:52:20.510Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: A memory initialization issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.4 and iPadOS 13.4, macOS Catalina 10.15.4, tvOS 13.4, watchOS 6.2. A malicious application may be able to execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges.

item.title: CVE-2020-9809|2024-08-04T10:43:05.132Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: An information disclosure issue was addressed with improved state management. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.5 and iPadOS 13.5, macOS Catalina 10.15.5, tvOS 13.4.5, watchOS 6.2.5. A malicious application may be able to determine kernel memory layout.

item.title: CVE-2020-9923|2024-08-04T10:43:05.408Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: A memory corruption issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.6 and iPadOS 13.6, watchOS 6.2.8. A malicious application may be able to execute arbitrary code with system privileges.

item.title: CVE-2020-9898|2024-08-04T10:43:05.417Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: This issue was addressed with improved entitlements. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.6 and iPadOS 13.6, macOS Catalina 10.15.6. A sandboxed process may be able to circumvent sandbox restrictions.

item.title: CVE-2020-3916|2024-08-04T07:52:20.387Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: An access issue was addressed with additional sandbox restrictions. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.4 and iPadOS 13.4, watchOS 6.2. Setting an alternate app icon may disclose a photo without needing permission to access photos.

item.title: CVE-2020-3858|2024-08-04T07:44:51.273Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: A memory corruption issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.3.1 and iPadOS 13.3.1. An application may be able to execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges.

item.description: An out-of-bounds read was addressed with improved bounds checking. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.3.1 and iPadOS 13.3.1, macOS Catalina 10.15.3, tvOS 13.3.1, watchOS 6.1.2. An application may be able to gain elevated privileges.

item.title: CVE-2020-9940|2024-08-04T10:50:56.257Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: A buffer overflow issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.6 and iPadOS 13.6, macOS Catalina 10.15.6, tvOS 13.4.8. Processing a maliciously crafted USD file may lead to unexpected application termination or arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2020-9880|2024-08-04T10:43:05.400Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: A buffer overflow was addressed with improved bounds checking. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.6 and iPadOS 13.6, macOS Catalina 10.15.6, tvOS 13.4.8, watchOS 6.2.8. Processing a maliciously crafted USD file may lead to unexpected application termination or arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2020-9900|2024-08-04T10:43:05.450Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: An issue existed within the path validation logic for symlinks. This issue was addressed with improved path sanitization. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.6 and iPadOS 13.6, macOS Catalina 10.15.6, tvOS 13.4.8, watchOS 6.2.8. A local attacker may be able to elevate their privileges.

item.title: CVE-2020-3890|2024-08-04T07:52:19.497Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: The issue was addressed with improved deletion. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.4 and iPadOS 13.4. Deleted messages groups may still be suggested as an autocompletion.

item.title: CVE-2020-9914|2024-08-04T10:43:05.467Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: An input validation issue existed in Bluetooth. This issue was addressed with improved input validation. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.6 and iPadOS 13.6, tvOS 13.4.8. An attacker in a privileged network position may be able to perform denial of service attack using malformed Bluetooth packets.

item.title: CVE-2020-3900|2024-08-04T07:52:19.674Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: A memory corruption issue was addressed with improved memory handling. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2020-9797|2024-08-04T10:43:05.100Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: An information disclosure issue was addressed by removing the vulnerable code. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.5 and iPadOS 13.5, macOS Catalina 10.15.5, tvOS 13.4.5, watchOS 6.2.5. A malicious application may be able to determine another application's memory layout.

item.title: CVE-2020-3914|2024-08-04T07:52:19.968Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: A memory initialization issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.4 and iPadOS 13.4, macOS Catalina 10.15.4, tvOS 13.4, watchOS 6.2. An application may be able to read restricted memory.

item.description: An out-of-bounds read was addressed with improved input validation. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.6 and iPadOS 13.6, macOS Catalina 10.15.6, tvOS 13.4.8, watchOS 6.2.8, iTunes 12.10.8 for Windows, iCloud for Windows 11.3, iCloud for Windows 7.20. Processing a maliciously crafted image may lead to arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2020-9862|2024-08-04T10:43:05.449Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: A command injection issue existed in Web Inspector. This issue was addressed with improved escaping. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.6 and iPadOS 13.6, tvOS 13.4.8, watchOS 6.2.8, Safari 13.1.2, iTunes 12.10.8 for Windows, iCloud for Windows 11.3, iCloud for Windows 7.20. Copying a URL from Web Inspector may lead to command injection.

item.title: CVE-2020-3842|2024-08-04T07:44:51.179Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: A memory corruption issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.3.1 and iPadOS 13.3.1, macOS Catalina 10.15.3, tvOS 13.3.1, watchOS 6.1.2. An application may be able to execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges.

item.title: CVE-2020-9863|2024-08-04T10:43:05.416Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: A memory initialization issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.6 and iPadOS 13.6, macOS Catalina 10.15.6, tvOS 13.4.8, watchOS 6.2.8. An application may be able to execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges.

item.title: CVE-2020-9785|2024-08-04T10:43:04.518Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: Multiple memory corruption issues were addressed with improved state management. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.4 and iPadOS 13.4, macOS Catalina 10.15.4, tvOS 13.4, watchOS 6.2. A malicious application may be able to execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges.

item.title: CVE-2020-9994|2024-08-04T10:50:57.260Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: A path handling issue was addressed with improved validation. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.5 and iPadOS 13.5, macOS Catalina 10.15.5, tvOS 13.4.5, watchOS 6.2.5. A malicious application may be able to overwrite arbitrary files.

item.title: CVE-2020-9905|2024-08-04T10:43:05.567Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: A buffer overflow was addressed with improved bounds checking. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.6 and iPadOS 13.6, macOS Catalina 10.15.6, tvOS 13.4.8. A remote attacker may be able to cause a denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2020-9838|2024-08-04T10:43:05.336Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: An out-of-bounds read was addressed with improved bounds checking. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.5 and iPadOS 13.5. A remote attacker may be able to cause arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2020-3856|2024-08-04T07:44:51.283Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: A memory corruption issue was addressed with improved input validation. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.3.1 and iPadOS 13.3.1, macOS Catalina 10.15.3, tvOS 13.3.1, watchOS 6.1.2. Processing a maliciously crafted string may lead to heap corruption.

item.title: CVE-2020-9952|2024-08-04T10:50:56.773Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: An input validation issue was addressed with improved input validation. This issue is fixed in iOS 14.0 and iPadOS 14.0, tvOS 14.0, watchOS 7.0, Safari 14.0, iCloud for Windows 11.4, iCloud for Windows 7.21. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to a cross site scripting attack.

item.title: CVE-2020-9889|2024-08-04T10:43:05.495Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: An out-of-bounds write issue was addressed with improved bounds checking. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.6 and iPadOS 13.6, macOS Catalina 10.15.6, tvOS 13.4.8, watchOS 6.2.8. Processing a maliciously crafted audio file may lead to arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2020-3888|2024-08-04T07:52:19.716Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: A logic issue was addressed with improved restrictions. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.4 and iPadOS 13.4. A maliciously crafted page may interfere with other web contexts.

item.title: CVE-2020-9825|2024-08-04T10:43:05.336Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: An access issue was addressed with additional sandbox restrictions. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.5 and iPadOS 13.5, macOS Catalina 10.15.5. A malicious application may be able to bypass Privacy preferences.

item.title: CVE-2020-3844|2024-08-04T07:44:51.347Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: This issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.3.1 and iPadOS 13.3.1. Users removed from an iMessage conversation may still be able to alter state.

item.title: CVE-2020-3902|2024-08-04T07:52:19.754Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: An input validation issue was addressed with improved input validation. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.4 and iPadOS 13.4, tvOS 13.4, Safari 13.1, iTunes for Windows 12.10.5, iCloud for Windows 10.9.3, iCloud for Windows 7.18. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to a cross site scripting attack.

item.title: CVE-2020-9938|2024-08-04T10:50:56.270Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: An out-of-bounds read was addressed with improved input validation. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.6 and iPadOS 13.6, macOS Catalina 10.15.6, tvOS 13.4.8, watchOS 6.2.8, iTunes 12.10.8 for Windows, iCloud for Windows 11.3, iCloud for Windows 7.20. Processing a maliciously crafted image may lead to arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2020-9906|2024-08-04T10:43:05.573Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: A memory corruption issue was addressed with improved input validation. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.6 and iPadOS 13.6, macOS Catalina 10.15.6, watchOS 6.2.8. A remote attacker may be able to cause unexpected system termination or corrupt kernel memory.

item.title: CVE-2020-9901|2024-08-04T10:43:05.482Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: An issue existed within the path validation logic for symlinks. This issue was addressed with improved path sanitization. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.6 and iPadOS 13.6, macOS Catalina 10.15.6, tvOS 13.4.8. A local attacker may be able to elevate their privileges.

item.title: CVE-2020-3840|2024-08-04T07:44:51.195Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: An off by one issue existed in the handling of racoon configuration files. This issue was addressed through improved bounds checking. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.3.1 and iPadOS 13.3.1, macOS Catalina 10.15.3, tvOS 13.3.1. Loading a maliciously crafted racoon configuration file may lead to arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2020-9890|2024-08-04T10:43:05.507Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: An out-of-bounds read was addressed with improved bounds checking. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.6 and iPadOS 13.6, macOS Catalina 10.15.6, tvOS 13.4.8, watchOS 6.2.8. Processing a maliciously crafted audio file may lead to arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2020-9777|2024-08-04T10:43:04.500Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: An issue existed in the selection of video file by Mail. The issue was fixed by selecting the latest version of a video. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.4 and iPadOS 13.4. Cropped videos may not be shared properly via Mail.

item.title: CVE-2020-9837|2024-08-04T10:43:05.151Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: An out-of-bounds read was addressed with improved bounds checking. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.5 and iPadOS 13.5, macOS Catalina 10.15.5, tvOS 13.4.5. A remote attacker may be able to leak memory.

item.title: CVE-2020-9893|2024-08-04T10:43:05.478Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: A use after free issue was addressed with improved memory management. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.6 and iPadOS 13.6, tvOS 13.4.8, watchOS 6.2.8, Safari 13.1.2, iTunes 12.10.8 for Windows, iCloud for Windows 11.3, iCloud for Windows 7.20. A remote attacker may be able to cause unexpected application termination or arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2020-3826|2024-08-04T07:44:51.025Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: An out-of-bounds read was addressed with improved input validation. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.3.1 and iPadOS 13.3.1, macOS Catalina 10.15.3, tvOS 13.3.1, watchOS 6.1.2, iTunes for Windows 12.10.4, iCloud for Windows 11.0, iCloud for Windows 7.17. Processing a maliciously crafted image may lead to arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2020-3838|2024-08-04T07:44:51.242Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: The issue was addressed with improved permissions logic. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.3.1 and iPadOS 13.3.1, macOS Catalina 10.15.3, tvOS 13.3.1, watchOS 6.1.2. An application may be able to execute arbitrary code with system privileges.

item.title: CVE-2020-9775|2024-08-04T10:43:04.399Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: An issue existed in the handling of tabs displaying picture in picture video. The issue was corrected with improved state handling. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.4 and iPadOS 13.4. A user's private browsing activity may be unexpectedly saved in Screen Time.

item.title: CVE-2020-3894|2024-08-04T07:52:19.503Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: A race condition was addressed with additional validation. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.4 and iPadOS 13.4, tvOS 13.4, Safari 13.1, iTunes for Windows 12.10.5, iCloud for Windows 10.9.3, iCloud for Windows 7.18. An application may be able to read restricted memory.

item.title: CVE-2020-9815|2024-08-04T10:43:05.089Z -- apple -- ios
item.description: An out-of-bounds read was addressed with improved bounds checking. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.5 and iPadOS 13.5, macOS Catalina 10.15.5, tvOS 13.4.5, watchOS 6.2.5. Processing a maliciously crafted audio file may lead to arbitrary code execution.
